column4: I have a Belkin USB-Ethernet adapter that only works with Ubuntu. There are no working drivers for Windows 7. I need to get the device through VirtualBox so it can connect to Ubuntu but that just doesnt seem to work (via a Windows 7 host).
once you get the device working in Win7 the Ubuntu guest will see it and treat it as a wired connection. Until it is working in the host, the guests cannot use it
well, your support for Win7 sucks.
as its a USB wii device, which are cheap. You could go buy a new one with Win7 support and it will work
